text: While I see your point about term limits, I think there are other factors to consider. For example, term limits could hinder the ability of Congress to complete long-term projects. Without the assurance of re-election, lawmakers may not invest in initiatives that take longer than their term to bear fruit. Moreover, term limits could also lead to a loss of experienced legislators who have a deep understanding of complex policy issues. This could negatively impact the quality of legislation.
